REALLY REALLY GOOD GAME LOVE THE PLOT AND THE BEAUTIFUL HOT SEXY BIHS EVERYWHERE I LUV THEM AND GOON TO THEM EVERY NIGHT NOW. THANK YOU FOR CREATING THIS MASTERPIECE. I WILL PRINT A PHOTO OF ALL OF THESE BABES AND STICK THEM TO MY WALL
The game is great, does need more male characters, though.

Fun, a high-quality GvG experience, with just the right amount of ecchiness. Currently, there are many mechs available, and the balance adjustments are positive, seemingly indicating a steady improvement?
However, the only thing to note is that although the gacha/reroll system is much more generous than most mobile games, it's still a pay-to-win gacha game; acquiring all the mechs requires time or money. A monthly pass/light spending is recommended; the experience is currently good.

This game has a very fun and wide array of characters where every interaction makes you feel like you need to adapt as well as working to counterplay the smallest things. Theres always new characters and more balance patches to keep the game fair, Its fun, its interactive, and its competitive, the only thing I would say is missing is more interactions with the characters and getting to learn about the world as someone whos come into the game late

This game is so good!

Lots of things to edit and customize with quick and fun games, super cool!

Its a very fun game. The combat is fluid and smooth, and I like the depth of each character.  I dont think its PTW, but I havent played it enough to know for sure. There are benefits for duplicate characters, but they dont seem to be very large.
I love this game, any game with mecha musume, that has model kit colabs is great.
the game are fun but the control are weird and take time to get used to it, i recommend using controller if you want a easy way to learn. also i think it best to play on mobile

is an Asian server version, and the account is not compatible with other servers. Starward is a 3D fighting game that integrates mecha girls and classic GVG combat gameplay, with 1V1 and 2V2 mode as the core gameplay.

I've played for only two days and I love the combat of this game. The fighting is super versatile, even tho obtaining characters is through a gatcha system there's a lot of free pulls, a training area to test them out and a lot more! If you like an arena fighting style game with fast paced combat and skill based button inputs (perfect dodges / blocks, melee and ranged combat combined, team / comp building, team strategy, etc) 

Warning that the default key binds feel like cheeks but once you rebind to your comfort the game is worth it. 

I've seen a lot of complaints about PTW thought even though there's duplicate buffs (eidolons, constellations, wtvr) the fighting game style makes it seem more like a skill issue than because of the cons. The fighting game style doesn't make it feel PTW at all and even with my 2 cost (Legendaries that aren't dps?? they feel more utility which is my play style) no talent team got to Masters 2 in 1v1s. 
Maybe this is a problem in 2v2 but I'm waiting for my friend to play so maybe I'll update based on that. 

It's free so if you'd like give the game a try! I'm definitely having a lot of fun. KITTY MAINS RISE!!!

5/5

TLDR: Super fun not ptw arena fighting style game, worth a try if interested. REALLY FUN

Great game with a very high skill ceiling, both keyboard controls and gamepad controls feel good after you get used to them. If you're a fan of any of the gundam versus games and waifu collectible games, you've come to the right place.

NA servers are pretty low populated, but the community seems to be growing with each new patch. Matchmaking will always pair you with a bot after a certain amount of time in que so theres at least that, real fun comes from intense ranked matches but you may have to find a discord group playing the game to know when to hop into que so you're not waiting too long.

All the characters are playable after only pulling 1 copy so you're not completely missing out playing f2p. Some characters are alot better than others when it comes to the talent up unlocks from multiple copies. Easy to max out the battlepass characters without spending any money if you play everyday. 

Overall its a good time if youre a fan of the arena style mech gameplay whether youre f2p or not, and definitely worth checking out.

I've played all of the home releases of the Gundam Versus series since Federation vs Zeon. EXVS2 as well. Starward's gameplay is true to the legacy. Starward does a better job at explaining mechanics and character specific tools. There are even interactive move explainers. Although it could do better in that regard since it's been a while since newer characters got any. I like how cancel routes are highlighted in real time. This makes using a new character easier if you haven't had a chance to look at their move list. At least 1 new character release every few weeks. There are seasons that last about 60 days. 6 characters were added last season. Also, there are events pretty regularly and the characters are pretty cool. I've been playing for about a year and haven't seen a disappointing one yet.

I almost forgot. Some may may be put off by some of the fan service-y character designs. I don't even think about. These are just functions. The gameplay stands up and keeps me here.

Starward is like if your favorite mecha anime and a 3D fighting game had a chaotic love child. You pick your mecha girl, each with her own attitude and fighting style, and proceed to punch, kick, and fly around like gravity is just a suggestion. The 1v1 and 2v2 battles are fast, flashy, and occasionally make you question why your cat-themed robot just threw your opponent across the map. Season 9 adds even more chaos with new characters, because apparently more flying mecha girls = more fun. 10/10, my thumbs have never been this busy.

The game itself is actually good and fun, but the launcher situation is frustrating. For the longest time, there was no standalone launcherâ€”only Steam and Mobileâ€”and for some reason, the IDs were separated. I was forced to maintain two different accounts.

Even now, those of us who mainly play on Steam still can't transfer our progress to play on mobile. And now that you finally release a standalone launcher, Steam players are expected to start over? What is the point of that? Why manage it this way?

[quote][b][url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microtransaction]Warning: Microtransaction infested mobile app![/url][/b]

This game is infested with a toxic mobile app style cash shop.  You will be prompted to and expected to give money to the developers through this cash shop to buy in-game goods so you can play the game.[/quote]

"Starward" is one of thousands of nasty mobile apps infesting the "free" section of Steam, but it's not really free.

As far as mobile apps go they actually put 3D graphics in, which may end up misleading people into thinking this is a real game, it's not.  It's a "gacha" PvP crapfest where the winner in each round is decided by how much money they spent.

There's only a superficial game here.   The game visuals and the game itself are incredibly shallow... think of them as the too-bright, colourful, thin plastic cabinet dress theme on a poker machine at the casino. That's basically what this is.  So really, the mobile app "game" is just a veneer, a thin skin wrapped around a nasty, predatory mobile app cash shop.

Putting that toxic mobile app monetisation aside... this is a mobile app.  I didn't spend thousands on a gaming PC so I could pretend it's an iPhone, and I don't think you did either... this kind of mobile app has no place in your Steam library.

As with all mobile scams, you're forced to sign a highly questionable yet legally unenforceable End User License Agreement... for such a relatively low effort, low quality mobile app, this is specifically designed to invalidate your consumer rights and destroy your right to privacy.  This agreement includes questionable requirements that may attempt to revoke consumer law protections that gamers expect to have, which is also highly problematic.  Developers must learn they are here to serve gamers, not control them.  I had my cat walk over the keyboard while the EULA was displaying, which fixed that problem for me.

This is a mobile app... it doesn't matter if this was ported to PC before or after the app store release, or even if this didn't even make it to the app stores.  This is built for the absolutely lowest of all gaming platforms and must be judged as such... it's not going to give you a cutting edge PC gaming experience.  That alone is enough to disqualify this from any recommendation.  We don't spend thousands building gaming rigs so that we can pretend they're iPhones and play iPhone games and mobile apps.

Now on to pricing and value for gamers.

Given that this free title won't increase your game collector count, is it worth your time to add it to your library?

Not on a bet.  This might be "free", but I still feel like I got ripped off.

Game plan is the same for every fight with just run away and use range attacks until the enemy pushes up since there is no penalty for playing so, and the controls could use some tuning up to make playing a bit smoother. Also pay to win is very prevalent in this game. Overall 4/10

2) This appears to be Asia server only for some reason.

3) The first hotkey I saw on the game was pressing "J" then I uninstalled it.
The control was too weird I cant play :\ why not use m1 and m2 as melee/gun and E/Q/Z/X/C/V/F/R as skill

The combat is cool but too many inputs for my liking. All weirdly placed on the keyboard. The character designs are all pretty good. I was expecting to be a full on like battler but there is like actual sorta story mode where you can grind for pulls which is cool.

[quote][b][url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microtransaction]Warning: Microtransaction infested mobile app![/url][/b]

This game is infested with a toxic mobile app style cash shop.  You will be prompted to and expected to give money to the developers through this cash shop to buy in-game goods so you can play the game.[/quote]

"Starward" is one of thousands of nasty mobile apps infesting the "free" section of Steam, but it's not really free.

As far as mobile apps go they actually put 3D graphics in, which may end up misleading people into thinking this is a real game, it's not.  It's a "gacha" PvP crapfest where the winner in each round is decided by how much money they spent.

There's only a superficial game here.   The game visuals and the game itself are incredibly shallow... think of them as the too-bright, colourful, thin plastic cabinet dress theme on a poker machine at the casino. That's basically what this is.  So really, the mobile app "game" is just a veneer, a thin skin wrapped around a nasty, predatory mobile app cash shop.

Putting that toxic mobile app monetisation aside... this is a mobile app.  I didn't spend thousands on a gaming PC so I could pretend it's an iPhone, and I don't think you did either... this kind of mobile app has no place in your Steam library.

As with all mobile scams, you're forced to sign a highly questionable yet legally unenforceable End User License Agreement... for such a relatively low effort, low quality mobile app, this is specifically designed to invalidate your consumer rights and destroy your right to privacy.  This agreement includes questionable requirements that may attempt to revoke consumer law protections that gamers expect to have, which is also highly problematic.  Developers must learn they are here to serve gamers, not control them.  I had my cat walk over the keyboard while the EULA was displaying, which fixed that problem for me.

This is a mobile app... it doesn't matter if this was ported to PC before or after the app store release, or even if this didn't even make it to the app stores.  This is built for the absolutely lowest of all gaming platforms and must be judged as such... it's not going to give you a cutting edge PC gaming experience.  That alone is enough to disqualify this from any recommendation.  We don't spend thousands building gaming rigs so that we can pretend they're iPhones and play iPhone games and mobile apps.

Now on to pricing and value for gamers.

Given that this free title won't increase your game collector count, is it worth your time to add it to your library?

Not on a bet.  This might be "free", but I still feel like I got ripped off.

Game plan is the same for every fight with just run away and use range attacks until the enemy pushes up since there is no penalty for playing so, and the controls could use some tuning up to make playing a bit smoother. Also pay to win is very prevalent in this game. Overall 4/10

1) The game started in Chinese I guess and didn't even give me the ability to change the language before starting anything and then forced me into tutorial mode.

2) This appears to be Asia server only for some reason.

3) The first hotkey I saw on the game was pressing "J" then I uninstalled it.
The control was too weird I cant play :\ why not use m1 and m2 as melee/gun and E/Q/Z/X/C/V/F/R as skill

The combat is cool but too many inputs for my liking. All weirdly placed on the keyboard. The character designs are all pretty good. I was expecting to be a full on like battler but there is like actual sorta story mode where you can grind for pulls which is cool.

This game is trash

This is a singleplayer game disguised as a multiplayer game, all the "players" are literal NPC Bots.
The combat is trash, all the characters play the exact the same and have the same moveset.

Just a lazy cash grab targeted towards disabled retards

Bro I WOULD LITERALLY WRITE YALL A GOOD REVIEW IF YALL COULD JUST MAKE IT POSSIBLE TO LOGIN INTO UR ACCOUNT FROM MOBILE. SOMETHING SIMPLE, i have waited idk how many seasons for that to happen and all i wanna do is continue my progress from mobile on PC so i can play this GundamvsGundam anime edition with controller and smooth butter 144fps in peace but NAH ya'll wont add that feature so idk man. Just pls add that feature PLS

The game itself is actually good and fun, but the launcher situation is frustrating. For the longest time, there was no standalone launcherâ€”only Steam and Mobileâ€”and for some reason, the IDs were separated. I was forced to maintain two different accounts.

Even now, those of us who mainly play on Steam still can't transfer our progress to play on mobile. And now that you finally release a standalone launcher, Steam players are expected to start over? What is the point of that? Why manage it this way?

ngl bro the gameplay itself is kinda fun but everything else is just bad, good thing its a free game
also i get high ping even playing against bots
